name: Four Points by Sheraton Jacksonville Baymeadows

reviews.text: Had an opportunity to stay at the Four Points Jacksonville twice in June and both occasions were very relaxing and quiet. Both Ryan and Wade at the front desk were very personable and helpful and made my stay very much worth while. I will look forward to a return visit when the opportunity arises again!!
reviews.title: Quiet and Relaxing

reviews.text: Boy talk about friendly people, nice happy hour and great room you can't beat this hotel for the price. Ryan at the frond desk bent over backwords
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here one night and found it comfortable and secure. Some people were being loud by slamming doors but nothing too severe. It was in a nice area and it was a fancy place. Would stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.text: To begin, this room is right next to the elevator. There are no blackout curtains and this room isright in front of the entry where the security lights shine into the room. If you plan on sleeping, you must get creative to block the light. Staff was nice. Only other thing was it seems the HSIA seems to be running of a dial up connection but its free so I suppose I can't complain.
reviews.title: Avoid room 210

reviews.text: Just stay away from room 210.
reviews.title: Beautiful Decor and pleasant staff!

reviews.text: I stayed here recently with a large group for a soccer tournament. The staff was very helpful. Even prior to arriving, Amanda was awesome to deal with. Like a breath of fresh air. You could feel her smile over the phone. She was just as pleasant in person. The other front desk staff were just as helpful and accomodating.
reviews.title: Room was just OK

reviews.text: My problem was with the room itself. The bathroom had a sliding door that left a huge gap that you could see through when it was closed. From the bedroom, you could see straight through to the toilet. Since my daughter brought along a friend, this was uncomfortable. We had to announce to the others each time we were going to use the toilet to assure privacy.
reviews.title: Good bed, good space, good people, good food at an extremely fair price.

reviews.text: The room was noisy. I had to get up the first night to be sure the door to the hallway was closed. It sure sounded like it was open but it was not. We had to get up very early on the second day. There was a party going on off the lobby very late into the night. Even though we were on the third floor, the constant thumping of the music kept us from getting a good nights sleep. If you can't get a good nights sleep, what good is a hotel?
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good price

reviews.text: The breakfast was very good. The eggs were cooked fresh. The bacon was perfect. Great coffee and plenty of fruit and cereal, bagels and pastries. I decided to sit at the table closest to the TV in the dining area while I ate since there was something interesting showing. While it should have been obvious that I was watching, since I was five feet away and facing the TV, the cashier woman moved between me and the TV and changed the channel. Really? How rude!
reviews.title: A little escape...

reviews.text: At check out, there were no baggage carts available for 45 minutes. Yes I know it was check out time for everybody, and people tend to hoard the carts to avoid the dilemna I was in, but I was told the hotel had only three carts. Maybe they need to invest in a few more?
reviews.title: Great staff. Nice rooms. Good price.

reviews.text: Good room, clean and comfortable, if you have business in Jacksonville it's perfect. We visited Saint Augustin a couple times while here but would prefer to stay closer next time. We had no problems with the reservations, we had two rooms for severals days. The staff was friendly.
reviews.title: Clean and Comfortable
Dont book here
reviews.text: I am a platinum member for seveal years at SPG. I have stayed 54 nights so far this year 383 nights in the last 13 years.

Yesterday morning, I booked a room on the SPG Website for one night that evening. When I checked in, the staff could not find the reservation, but told me that SPG had a problem with their computer system that morning and they had had problems with their reservation system all day. I logged on my SPG website and discovered that the reservation reflected was showing 3 nights over the weekend starting on the 28th on a prepaid rate. I asked the hotel to cancel the stay at no charge, but the front desk manager stated I had to contact SPG. I booked another room that night and contacted SPG this afternoon and they said they had to contact the hotel. The same desk manager then declined to make the adjustment.
reviews.title: just what you need

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is horrible service towards an elite member and completely unacceptable.
reviews.title: Comfortable and clean

reviews.text: jacksonville is a huge city, so after driving long distances and when returning to your room, you dont want a hassle... as with so many similar hotels across the country that look alike and offer the same type of space, this room was generically comfortable and clean... bathroom was sparkling and the bed was more than comfy..
reviews.title: Great Value Business Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed for a 2-night stopover on the way farther south. This is a serviceable lodging, a short enough drive from I95 for convenience and far enough to get away from the road noise. The hotel, about 4-years old seems spanking brand new and is so clean, And that's where I quibble…
reviews.title: Super clean and efficient. That’s the problem…

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The architect and interior designer seem to have lost their way. Hotels of this type are not known for having warm interiors, but the interior of this facility uses such hard materials throughout that it made me feel like being in a hospital. The lobby had copious amounts of stainless steel and faux wood paneling. The ultra-brightly lit elevators – also stainless steal and faux wood -- are at least 20 degrees cooler than the hallways and lobby. Passengers are subject to a loud buzz for each passing floor and must breathe the strong scent of a stick-on air freshener, strong enough to fight odors in a 400 square-foot room. Thankfully there are only 4 floors. Why an air freshener in an elevator ?
reviews.title: clean and reasonable
Very comfortable, reasonable weekend rates
reviews.text: The elevator doors open into an unmarked narrow off-shoot of the main hallway, leaving the impression that you may have arrived in a basement storage room. The hallway rugs, are obviously new and clean, but feel paper thin. The room entryway greets you with more faux wood flooring. The bathroom is white on white on white. Not a splotch of color. And the tiniest towel hooks are as far from the shower as possible. A stall shower with a swinging instead of sliding door guarantees floor flooding. The bathroom door itself, with a nautical porthole, is a behemoth on massive sliding hinges. The hardware looks downright prison-like.

The rooms are at least 2-feet too narrow. A giant 8-foot high credenza serves as TV stand, clothing armoire and slide-out desktop. Unfortunately, the closet is not deep and the side facing hangers are awkward. With the desktop opened, the chair jams up against the bed. The closet door opens practically against the bed. One forlorn abstract picture sits in a dark corner.
reviews.title: Wonderful Place to stay

reviews.text: I selected Starwood because of its reputation and my experience with their comfortable beds. Unfortunately, this one was hard, like the rest of the hotel. The mattress gives about 2-inches then promptly runs into a solid base. I always get a queezy feeling when waking up in the morning and finding that the fitted bottom sheet came loose leaving you laying on the actual mattress. Try not to imagine who else slept here. A king bed needs king sheets.
reviews.title: Great experience

description: Four Points by Sheraton Jacksonville Baymeadows is located near FL area attractions, businesses, and beaches. We have free high speed internet access, a meeting room, and delectable dining options.
